Enterprise AI Spend Up 94%, The "AI Tax" Hits Renewals, Search Shifts to Actions

Today's top stories in AI + Product Marketing

1

Tropic Report: Enterprise AI-Native Spend Up 94% YoY

New data from $18B in software spend under management reveals that mid-market and enterprise companies grew AI-Native spend by 94% year-over-year ‚Äî nearly double the 51% growth for hybrid tools, and dramatically outpacing Primarily SaaS at just 8%. The verdict is clear: companies are placing serious bets on purpose-built AI, not just AI features bolted onto legacy platforms.

Read on Tropic ‚Üí
2

The "AI Tax" Is Real: Vendors Pushing 20-37% Price Increases

From the same Tropic report: vendors are leveraging AI to push renewal price increases of 20-37% ‚Äî far beyond typical 3-9% annual uplifts. Tactics include forced SKU migrations, unbundling then rebundling features, and credit-based pricing that obscures true costs. The silver lining? Negotiation works ‚Äî bringing final uplifts down to ~12% on average.

Read on Tropic ‚Üí
3

WordStream: Search Shifts From Answers to Actions

In-depth analysis of the 2026 AI marketing landscape. Key insight: users no longer search "plumber near me" ‚Äî they ask "Can you get someone to fix my sink this afternoon?" AI assistants don't show options; they select providers. This changes the game for PMMs: visibility now depends on how easily AI can interpret and reuse your data.

Read on WordStream ‚Üí
4

FirmPilot Raises $22M for AI-Powered Legal Marketing

Vertical AI is getting serious investment. FirmPilot closed an oversubscribed Series A-1 to scale their all-in-one AI platform for law firm marketing ‚Äî including AI-driven SEO, GEO (AI search optimization), PPC, and competitive blueprinting. Shows how AI is enabling specialists to build full-stack marketing solutions for specific industries.

Read on AI Journal ‚Üí
5

Mersel AI Launches Brand Citation Platform for AI Search

New tool focused on an emerging PMM challenge: getting your brand mentioned in AI-generated search results. Mersel AI's platform aims to increase brand citation frequency when users ask LLMs questions. As AI search grows (ChatGPT now has 800M+ weekly users), "generative engine optimization" is becoming as critical as traditional SEO.

Read on MarTech ‚Üí

üí° My Take

Read this one: The Tropic report is essential reading. The 94% YoY growth in AI-Native spend ‚Äî while "Primarily SaaS" limps along at 8% ‚Äî tells you where the market is heading. If you're at a vendor that hasn't meaningfully integrated AI, you're losing wallet share. And if you're buying software, prepare for the AI Tax conversations at renewal time.
